details.formulaStrippedArticleTitle: Robust direction of arrival estimate method in FM-based passive bistatic radar with a four-element Adcock antenna array
details.title: Robust direction of arrival estimate method in FM-based passive bistatic radar with a four-element Adcock antenna array
details.standardTitle: Robust direction of arrival estimate method in FM-based passive bistatic radar with a four-element Adcock antenna array
details.abstract: This study examines the problem of direction of arrival (DOA) estimation in FM-based passive bistatic radar using a four-element Adcock antenna array. The authors investigate the influence of the target echo, involved in the reference signal, on the DOA estimation of the corresponding target considered. Analysis shows that, unlike the pure reference signal case, a weak target echo involved in the reference signal may not affect the detection of the corresponding target. It can often have a significant impact on the estimation of a target's DOA; thus typical DOA estimate methods degrade heavily. A robust method is proposed to cope with this problem. Simulation and experimental results demonstrate the effectiveness of the method.

ieee.displayText: C. Palmarini, T. Martelli, F. Colone, P. Lombardo, "Disturbance removal in passive radar via sliding extensive cancellation algorithm (ECA-S)", Radar Conference 2015 IEEE, pp. 162-167, 2015.
ieee.title: Disturbance removal in passive radar via sliding extensive cancellation algorithm (ECA-S)

ieee.displayText: Fabiola Colone, Claudio Palmarini, Tatiana Martelli, Enrico Tilli, "Sliding extensive cancellation algorithm for disturbance removal in passive radar", Aerospace and Electronic Systems IEEE Transactions on, vol. 52, pp. 1309-1326, 2016, ISSN 0018-9251.
ieee.title: Sliding extensive cancellation algorithm for disturbance removal in passive radar
